page.title: 12SMITH PARKINSON, BRIGG
page.content: At Smith Parkinson's garage they start work at 8.3O a.m. First of all the garage floor and benches are swept and tidied. The Service Manager, Mr Parkinson, comes into the garage and tells the workmen what work to do. The qualified mechanics do the main jobs such as repairing and replacing engines, mending bodywork on crashed cars and doing Ministry of Transport tests known as M.O.T. for all cars three years old and over. Meanwhile the boys on the Youth Training Scheme check oil, water and tyres. This is called servicing. They also polish the cars before they are sent back to the owners if the cars are quite new. They finish work at 5.3O p.m.
